intro: Fraxinus humilior, commonly known as the dwarf ash, is a small to medium-sized deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 feet and has a rounded, symmetrical crown. The leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate with serrated margins, turning yellow in the fall. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, appearing in clusters, and it produces samaras for seed dispersal. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age.
